Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo ID voting law in Georgia has not dissuaded black voters from participating in voting. This assumption may be problematic because it overlooks potential barriers or deterrents that the law may have created for black voters.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the photo ID law has been helpful in increasing black voter participation. The statement relies on anecdotal evidence from politicians rather than comprehensive research or analysis.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the increase in voter participation among all racial groups in Georgia. It assumes that the photo ID law is the sole cause of the increase, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the rise in voter turnout.
